ratings.comment: great professor

The professor is friendly and very knowledgeable and passionate about the subjects taught in this course, but he does not know how to teach the material to students with very little immunological background and his exams are poorly designed. This class is a pretty easy A even if you get a 0 or negative points on an exam.

Take this class. You won't learn anything, and the exams are obnoxious, but the curve is out of this world. You don't have to attend class, probably shouldn't bother trying to study for exams, and likely won't have to take final. Professor is awful at teaching, but to his credit, he seems very knowledgeable and passionate about immunology.

Dr. Malkovsky is very approachable outside of class for questions. His biggest flaw is his exam logic. The lectures are VERY content heavy, and rather interesting, but not much of the material is tested. Exams are all true and false, with a guessing penalty. Very intelligent guy, just doesn't know how to structure a class

Do not, DO NOT take this class. The online take-home is a thing of the past. This is the first semester that we have to take the quizzes in-class, and the time given is impossible (1.5 hrs). I wish I had dropped the class immediately, but thought it would be doable. You do not learn, you pray that you find a SMALL amount of answers online.

This class is absolutely the worst class I've taken at the UW. LITERALLY nothing on exams in covered in lecture, and 90% of the class doesn't attend lecture after the first day. Exams are all take-home, T/F but questions are ambiguous and way above the level of the content for an introductory immunology class. DO NOT TAKE! Ruined my GPA :(

By FAR, the WORSE CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN AT THE UW. DO NOT, I REPEAT, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. THE EXAMS ARE RIDICULOUS! It's open book, but NOTHING, literally NOTHING is in the lectures. Lecture slides are ridiculous! I wished I never took this class. IT IS NOT an EASY A. Don't be tricked. This class has truly ruined my semester.

This is the worst class I have taken in my time at UW. Horrible professor, horrible exam format (all true/false that can be either if interpreted one way or another) and just an overall bad experience. Avoid Professor Malkovsky.

I went to class one time and got an A. The exams (there are 3, and a final that you probably won't have to take) are all online and you can literally find half of the answers for the exams online from past exams that people posted. The first exam was 100% online, the second exam was hard to find but doable and third exam was easy to find. TAKE THIS

This class is completely useless. If you want an easy A and don't want to learn anything because you enjoy wasting your college tuition money, then this class is perfect for you. Take-home exams are the only reason people succeed. I wouldn't even bother going to class, just work on the take-home exams with other people and you're golden.

Seriously? This class is a joke because of the professor and how he teaches it. It's nearly impossible to learn anything meaningful from his thick mumbling accent or his text-heavy, copied and pasted powerpoint slides. Take home exams are easy to work on with a group of people. Easy A, but its an awesome subject that is so so oh so poorly taught :(
Don't take this class! Horrible professor.  Just horrible.  The university needs to investigate this professor. 75% of student don't show up after the 1st lecture.

I learned absolutely NOTHING from this class. Take home exams 120-140 T/F question where you lose points if get it wrong, so you can get a negative score. Class is not worth your time if you want to learn anything. The professor is rude & demeaning. The average on the final was a 15 yet you need 341 points to get an A in the course.

Thick accent- Very hard to understand. Slides have LOTS of info, but he skips over those or reads them straight from the slide. Exams are 150 T/F questions and hard. But you get bonus point for asking questions, attending discussion and answering questions in class. Likes to talk about immunology but doesn't like to teach it.
Horrible!  Painful to listen to his lectures.  Horrible presenter. Lecture slides are junky cut and paste from book.  My recommendation: Don't take the class!!!

ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!!!! I would recommend not taking this class.  It wasn't as easy an A as people say because the exams take 6+ hours.  You are also not guaranteed the extra credit, it depends on what he feels that day. You can't understand a word he says, and he mumbles a lot.  His knowledge is impressive, but not for this beginning level.

I learned absolutely NOTHING from this class.  Although this class is an easy A because there are take home exams and extra credit is given if you ask questions in class, it is not worth your time if you want to learn anything.  The professor is snarky, rude, and posts demeaning messages on learn@uw.  The average on the final was a 15%.

Very confusing and unclear. His English is very horrible, let alone his lecturing. The exams are take home and the entire lecture worked on them together, otherwise they would be impossible to do. The exams were also made up of 100+ true/false questions. Read the textbook, or else you will not learn anything in this class. Although, it's an easy A.
Very confusing. Lectures aren't helpful. The tests are more confusing than the lectures. Easy A but frustrating class. I was excited for the class but learned nothing.

Malkovsky is a good guy, he really knows his stuff but at times he talks way above people and assumes they know what he's talking about. Easy A if you put in the work on the take home exams. Unlike others here I feel I actually learned quite a bit but I went to most of the lectures. Sometimes they were tedious but  sometimes really interesting.

The easist class I have taken at UW madison. All exams are take home exams, which are >100~120 true or false questions and graded like SAT (penalties for guessing.) You have to get ~85% to get an A. Easy bio credits, but unfortunately useless class.
It's a really easy class.  The professor is pretty funny and interesting to listen to because of his accent.  He has really interesting stories because he has met with many famous people.

This was by far the most useless class I've taken. I attended lectures for a few weeks before realizing it wasn't necessary. The lectures are poorly organized and unhelpful and the exams would be almost impossible to complete based on the class if they weren't take-home. The class is an easy A, but I learned almost nothing.
Weird guy. Class is three take home exams and an in class final. Not hard if you put effort into the take-home exams.
